data.title: Select and rememeber language mode
data.body: Once I set language mode for the file (in my case VS Code does not understand one file is ASP), VS Code should remember this selection next time I open the project. Since editor cannot do it automatically, each time I open a project with ASP files I have to manually set language mode over and over again.

data.title: Multiple cursors + Word wrap

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The current behaviour in VSCode with `"editor.wordWrap": "on" ` is like this:
![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5332158/19222557/a85d2168-8e31-11e6-985a-e328a6c3b11c.gif)

But I would prefer an option for this
![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5332158/20053063/ffbafc3a-a4bd-11e6-9f92-80733ca6c606.gif)

Note I used the gif from [here](https://github.com/SublimeTextIssues/Core/issues/1054) which I found while looking for a solution.

data.title: Incorrect information on JSON method
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In a JS file, type JSON.parse()
2. In a JS file, type JSON.stringify

The information that is displayed is the one in the pictures.

![json parse](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22588741/25903531/98139b56-3594-11e7-9d3a-3f8117244960.png)

![json stringify](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22588741/25903535/9aa03578-3594-11e7-99e2-c0e74e81f396.png)

Which is incorrect, according to 
[JSON.parse in MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON/parse)
[JSON.stringifyin MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON/stringify)

data.title: unrecognized option `--install-extension'
data.body:
I cannot install any extensions via the command line. I constantly get: 

``` bash
$ code --install-extension ms-vscode.cpptools
open: unrecognized option `--install-extension'
Usage: open [-e] [-t] [-f] [-W] [-R] [-n] [-g] [-h] [-b <bundle identifier>] [-a <application>] [filenames] [--args arguments]
Help: Open opens files from a shell.
      By default, opens each file using the default application for that file.
      If the file is in the form of a URL, the file will be opened as a URL.
Options:
      -a                Opens with the specified application.
      -b                Opens with the specified application bundle identifier.
      -e                Opens with TextEdit.
      -t                Opens with default text editor.
      -f                Reads input from standard input and opens with TextEdit.
      -F  --fresh       Launches the app fresh, that is, without restoring windows. Saved persistent state is lost, excluding Untitled documents.
      -R, --reveal      Selects in the Finder instead of opening.
      -W, --wait-apps   Blocks until the used applications are closed (even if they were already running).
          --args        All remaining arguments are passed in argv to the application's main() function instead of opened.
      -n, --new         Open a new instance of the application even if one is already running.
      -j, --hide        Launches the app hidden.
      -g, --background  Does not bring the application to the foreground.
      -h, --header      Searches header file locations for headers matching the given filenames, and opens them.
```
Attempting to install an extension keeps failing for me even via the marketplace within the app. Every install attempt just stalls. 

- VSCode Version: 1.21.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.10.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open command line
2. Run command `code --install-extension <extension-name>`

data.title: ext install <extension name> doesn't install extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: v1.12.1
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to [VS Code extension marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/vscode)
2. Click on any extension to view it's homepage
3. At the top of the page you will see this example, which appears on *every extension's page*:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2685357/25901135/734e34fc-359e-11e7-8a0b-a4ee9171ef4c.png)
4. Go to VSCode
5. Follow the instructions:
6. Hit `ctrl+p`
7. Type: `ext install cpptools` (for example)
8. Hit Enter.
9. Only extension bar opens, but the extension does not install.
10. To reach install button using keyboard only, use `ctrl+m` (change tab moves focus) and hit Tab key 11 times. Then hit Enter. Again. Or:
11. Use the slowly mouse & despair.

I am using the direct command, why can't VSCode just install the extension? If the VSCode team agrees this is a broken feature, I wouldn't mind working on a PR :)

data.title: Cursor gets wrong offset through zoom-in/out
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:40:39.245Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|1.1.0|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1|
|java|redhat|0.2.0|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.3.1|
|trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|
|language-stylus|sysoev|1.6.0|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.2|
|markdown-pdf|yzane|0.1.7|;
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. have a multi-line Text open in Editor. Use wrap mode. Cursor somewhere 1/3rd from left.
2. Add/remove a few characters.
3. Zoom In (enlarge / `ctrl-+`). Type a letter.

RESULT: Actual inserting is 10-15px further left, than the seeming cursor position: Here I typed three 'A' and didn't move the cursor after that... yet, the cursor seems 1¼ chars further right...

EXPECTED: correct Cursor position.

* Closing and reopening file doesn't heal.
* Effect ist stronger closer to the right side of the panel.
* I only noticed this bug in the last 1-3 releases, not before. (And I zoom quite a bit :)

![bug-3a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21154106/25901719/ea8acee2-3597-11e7-94c9-5cf2e590c035.png)

data.title: Spectron: Main window focus is lost when starting from the fresh '--user-data-dir'
data.body:
Ref: #25291

VS Code main window focus is being lost by an opening of 'Getting Started' page upon starting from the fresh user data directory. This causes some tests to fail due to the page opening that happens during the activity of WebDriver actions.

data.title: VSCore repeatedly ask for ssh key password every 3 min
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.2 Linux 4.4.0-75-generic x86_64 LXDE

VSCore repeatedly ask for ssh key password every 3 min., even without any activity from my side. I can just open repository cloned using ssh and it will ask for the password every 3 minutes.

data.title: CMD + down (Mac Users) don't lost explorer focus
data.body:
Hi !

The default behaviour of vscode is to loose the focus of the explorer when we it "CMD+Down" shortcut.
It will be awesome to add another command to allow to open file preview to side, without loosing focus from explorer (sublime text like).

Thanks !

data.title: [json] Incorrect JSON schema validation after local schema change

- VSCode Version: 1.12

I'm having the same issue as Changes to JSON schema are not reflected #13897. Since that issue is from October last year, I'm opening a fresh one.

My JSON:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/101152/25896813/f65cbbde-3585-11e7-93b7-de79529cafe6.png)

data.title: User settings wiped
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:40:39.245Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-77-generic
- Extensions: the listing exceeds the lower minimum of browsers' URL characters limit
---

I cant reproduce the bug so this is probably unhelpful, but here's how it happened:

1. Pressed ctrl + to zoom & got a message VS needs to restart to apply settings. 
2. Clicked cancel (was on a roll).
3. VS reset to default everything on clicking cancel.
4. Closed VS & reopened but the settings where still the default.
5. Checked .config settings json and it was certainly wiped.

Cheers :)

data.title: Request: Add regex support to snippets
data.body:
Being able to do this would be fantastic and drastically increase snippets usefulness above and beyond the example provided

One use case for example is below, I'd love to be able to auto complete anyvar:AcceptInput() while currently there's no way that I've seen to do so.

```json
"ENT:AcceptInput":
{
	"scope": "source.lua",
	"body": ":AcceptInput($0)",
	"prefix": ".*:AcceptInput",
	"description": "SHARED Method: ENT:AcceptInput()"
}
```

data.title: Inactive editor group tab color fade
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12
- OS Version: Windows 10

Currently there is no setting for adjusting inactive editor tab as after 1.12 version update it fades and it's almost impossible to read in comparison with active editor group tabs.
It would be better if active editor would have an outline/border to highlight it's activity status. In that case inactive editors could be left untouched by fading to show their status.

data.title: add workbench.action.nextWindow and workbench.action.previousWindow
data.body:
Since the new 1.12 MacOs option `window.nativeTabs` is really great, it will be very helpfull to have functions to easily switch to previous and next window from keyboard like : 
- `workbench.action.previousWindow`
- `workbench.action.nextWindow`

Thanks to consider.

data.title: Ability to theme ruler colour
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Add option in `workbench.colorCustomizations` to theme the ruler colour.

data.title: Preview Git SCM cannot stage/unstage lines in network workspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.14.1|
|copy-relative-path|alexdima|0.0.1|
|Handlebars|andrejunges|0.2.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|gitlens|eamodio|3.4.9|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.9|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.12|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.16|
|vscode-yarn|gamunu|1.1.0|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|rest-client|humao|0.14.2|
|phpcs|ikappas|0.7.0|
|vscode-autoprefixer|mrmlnc|2.0.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1|
|gi|rubbersheep|0.2.10|
|vscode-paste-and-indent|Rubymaniac|0.0.8|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.24.0|
|Align|steve8708|0.2.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|es-quotes|vilicvane|0.2.5|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open workspace on a network share, e.g. \\server\share
2. Try and stage a single change from a file with multiple changes

Expected Results:

* Changes are staged correctly.

Actual Results:

* Sometimes errors in the Output > Git window, including `error: Invalid path 'C:/path/on/network/share'`
* Many times no errors, but it never stages or un-stages anything

data.title: Unhelpful error message when starting debugger
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

I've installed the WinDbg Debugger extension from [here](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=reznikdi.windbg-debug).

I've used the suggested configuration, but when I try to start the debugger I get the error
**Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined**

I've also recieved this error when attaching to a remote debugger (gdb), so I don't think this is specific to the WinDbg extension.

Any ideas how to proceed?

data.title: Awkward line breaks in new completion view
data.body:
(Insider's build c615b43b)

The new completion view frequently produces awkward line breaks with the Haxe extension. Here's an example:

![](http://i.imgur.com/8c5Q4Eq.png)

It tends to break after `?`, which looks strange, because the `?` belongs to the parameter (`?` indicates an optional parameter in Haxe). Breaking after `(` / `,` would be more natural. I don't think there's a way to control this behavior currently?

In 1.12.0, this wasn't really an issue, mostly because a lot of info is hidden / there were no line breaks. :)

![](http://i.imgur.com/E6884Wq.png)

data.title: Wrong intellisense overlay position in split-view
data.body: The intellisense suggestion overlay is not positioned at the cursor inside the right editor pane. This only happens in split view. - VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insider c615b43be67170e166779c9020a249442c4f36fc - OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. open vscode 2. split editor pane 3. type in the right pane

data.title: Show file (and position) of workspace symbols
data.body:
Since workspace symbol search has a high chance of returning many items with duplicate names we should show the file and position where they are defined. Also, this information should be searchable. 

TypeScript has [ghetto fix](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/c94789c509a8d85400d3d94bc70c8456af1b0a09 ) this which is bad because 
* it breaks with the paradigm that extensions provide data and that we provide the presentation/ui by abusing todays rendering/layout
* it assumes only TypeScript developers are interested in this information and sets a bad sample 
* it messes with folks that use this information via the complex api command (`vscode.executeWorkspaceSymbolProvider`)

data.title: MakesTextEdit context key must not be a precondition but keybinding condition
data.body: Related to the discussion in #24420 have this a command precondition makes it hard to re-configure the keybinding. It should move into the keybindings-when which makes this easier to customise.

data.title: Feature/plugin request - Stub generation and refactoring
data.body:
Hello,
VSCode is awesome and I'd love to replace PHPStorm with it, but there are two features that I really miss:

- Automatically generate get/set/constructor/interface methods
- Refactoring (like I change the name of a class and bam, it changes everywhere)

Are there any plans for this? Thank you!
